inscription:
Obverse: SIGISMVNDVS PANDVLFVS MALATESTA · PAN[dulfi] · F[ilius] · PONTIFICII · EXER · IMP [Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta, son of Pandolfo]
Reverse: *M·CCCC·XLVI *
text:
Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta (1417–1468)
was a skillful condottiere and feudal lord of Rimini from 1432 until his death. A cultivated patron of the arts, he brought illustrious Renaissance artists to Rimini, including the accomplished medalist, architect, and painter Matteo di Pasti, a student of Pisanello. Matteo produced numerous portrait medals of Malatesta. This example portrays the sitter wearing a simple shirt and doublet rather than armor.
The reverse of the medal represents the allegory of Fortitude in a crown and cuirass, carrying a broken column and sitting atop two elephants, a heraldic device of the Malatesta family.
title: Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta, Lord of Rimini
